purpose: To provide direct income support to small and marginal farmers.
benefit: Rs. 6,000 per year in three equal installments.
eligibility: All small and marginal farmers owning up to 2 hectares of land.

steps: Go to your nearest Common Service Centre (CSC) or local agriculture office in your village or block.
Take your Aadhaar card, land ownership papers, and a copy of your bank passbook with you.
Tell the officer you want to apply for the PM-KISAN scheme and ask for help filling the form.
Give your documents to the officer and let them fill the application form for you.
Check every detail in the form with the officer, and make sure your name, Aadhaar number, and bank details are correct.
Sign the form or put your thumb impression if you cannot sign.
Ask the officer to attach photocopies of your documents to the form.
Submit the completed form and documents to the officer and ask for an acknowledgment receipt.
Wait for the government officer to visit your field for verification if needed.
After approval, check with the CSC or online if your name is in the beneficiary list and wait for the money to come to your bank account.

help_links.title: How to Apply for PM-KISAN Scheme | Step by Step Guide

purpose: To provide timely credit to farmers for crop cultivation and allied activities.
benefit: Short-term loan up to Rs. 3 lakh at low interest rate.
eligibility: All farmers including tenant and sharecroppers.

steps: Visit the nearest bank branch (like SBI, PNB, or your local bank) with your Aadhaar card, land records, and a passport size photo.
Ask the bank staff for the Kisan Credit Card (KCC) application form and a list of required documents.
Sit with the bank staff and fill the form together, making sure all details are correct.
Attach photocopies of your Aadhaar card, land records, and photo to the form.
Submit the filled form and documents to the bank officer and ask for a receipt.
Wait for the bank to check your land records and verify your details. They may visit your field.
If your application is approved, the bank will call you to collect your KCC card and passbook.
Learn from the bank staff how to use the card to withdraw money for your farming needs.
Use the money for buying seeds, fertilizers, or other farm needs as per your plan.
Repay the loan after harvest on time to avoid extra charges and keep your card active.

help_links.title: Kisan Credit Card Full Process Explained in Hindi

purpose: To provide crop insurance to farmers against natural calamities.
benefit: Insurance cover for crop loss due to drought, flood, pests, etc.
eligibility: All farmers growing notified crops in notified areas.

steps: Go to your nearest bank branch or Common Service Centre (CSC) during the crop insurance enrollment period.
Carry your Aadhaar card, land records, and details of the crop you have sown.
Ask the officer for the PMFBY insurance form and request help to fill it.
Fill in your personal, land, and crop details carefully with the officer’s help.
Attach photocopies of your Aadhaar card, land records, and crop sowing proof to the form.
Pay the insurance premium amount as told by the officer and collect the payment receipt.
Submit the filled form and documents to the officer and get an acknowledgment slip.
Wait for the authorities to verify your details and confirm your insurance coverage.
If your crop is damaged, immediately inform the bank or CSC and fill a claim form.
Take clear photos of the damaged crop and submit them with your claim form for assessment.

help_links.title: PMFBY Crop Insurance Apply Online Hindi

purpose: To promote dairy farming and create self-employment.
benefit: Subsidy up to 33% for setting up dairy units.
eligibility: Farmers, individual entrepreneurs, SHGs, and cooperatives.

steps: Write a simple project report explaining your dairy plan (number of cows/buffaloes, shed, etc.).
Go to your nearest bank branch with your project report, Aadhaar card, land proof, and a passport size photo.
Ask the bank officer for the Dairy Entrepreneurship Development Scheme application form.
Fill the form with the officer’s help, making sure all details match your documents.
Attach photocopies of your Aadhaar card, land proof, and project report to the form.
Submit the form and documents to the bank officer and ask for a receipt.
Wait for the bank to send your application to NABARD for approval. They may visit your farm.
After approval, set up your dairy unit as per your plan (buy animals, build shed, etc.).
Keep all bills and receipts for your expenses and submit them to the bank for subsidy release.
Repay the loan in small installments as per the bank’s instructions to avoid penalties.

help_links.title: How to Start Dairy Farming with NABARD Subsidy

purpose: To promote holistic development of agriculture and allied sectors.
benefit: Financial assistance for farm infrastructure, seeds, and equipment.
eligibility: All farmers and farmer groups.

steps: Go to your district agriculture office and ask about the RKVY scheme and its benefits.
Collect the application form for RKVY and a list of required documents.
Fill the form with your name, address, land details, and what you want to buy (seeds, equipment, etc.).
Attach photocopies of your Aadhaar card, land records, and bank passbook to the form.
Submit the form and documents to the agriculture officer and get a receipt.
Wait for the officer to visit your field for verification and approval.
If selected, you will get an approval letter from the office.
Buy the approved items from a registered shop and keep all bills and receipts.
Submit the bills and receipts to the agriculture office for processing.
Wait for the subsidy amount to be credited to your bank account and confirm with the office.

help_links.title: RKVY Scheme Full Details in Hindi

purpose: To provide soil health cards to farmers for better crop planning.
benefit: Free soil testing and personalized fertilizer recommendations.
eligibility: All farmers owning or cultivating land.

steps: Visit your nearest Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK) or agriculture office.
Request for soil sample collection for your field.
Provide your land details and contact information.
Officials will collect soil samples from your field.
Samples will be tested in the laboratory.
You will receive a Soil Health Card with recommendations.
Follow the advice for better crop yield.
You can request soil testing every 3 years.
Contact the office for any doubts.
Keep the card safe for future reference.

help_links.title: Soil Health Card Scheme Explained

purpose: To promote organic farming among Indian farmers.
benefit: Financial assistance for organic inputs and certification.
eligibility: Farmers willing to adopt organic farming practices.

steps: Form a group of at least 50 farmers in your village.
Contact your local agriculture office for PKVY details.
Fill the group registration form with all members' details.
Submit land records and Aadhaar cards of all members.
Attend training sessions on organic farming.
Start organic farming as per guidelines.
Maintain records of inputs and practices.
Get your produce certified by the authorities.
Submit bills for organic inputs to the office.
Receive subsidy in your bank account.
